title: ‘Podi Lassie’ brought to Sri Lanka from India
byline: Organized criminal and alleged drug trafficker Arumahandi Janith Madhusankha de Silva, alias “Podi Lassie”, has been brought back to Sri Lanka from India by a special police team this morning (27).

title: Pakistan strikes Kabul hours after Afghanistan attack on border troops
byline: Pakistan carried out airstrikes in Kabul and two other Afghan provinces early Friday, Afghanistan’s government spokesperson said, hours after Afghanistan launched a cross-border attack on Pakistan in the latest escalation of violence between the volatile neighbours that made a Qatar-mediated ceasefire appear increasingly shaky.

title: Mainly fair weather expected in parts of the island
byline: Mainly fair weather will prevail over the most parts of the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Mainly fair weather expected in most parts of the island
byline: Mainly fair weather will prevail over the most parts of the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: ‘Podi Lassie’ to be handed over to Galle Crimes Division
byline: Arumahandi Janith Madhusankha de Silva, alias “Podi Lassie” — a high-profile alleged drug trafficker wanted by police in connection with multiple homicides — was escorted from the Bandaranaike International Airport following his arrival on the island early this morning (27).

title: World Economic Forum boss quits after review of Epstein links
byline: The president and CEO of the World Economic Forum (WEF), Borge Brende, has resigned after a review into his links to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: President to inaugurate ‘Himikama’ national programme in Anuradhapura today
byline: The inaugural ceremony of the national programme for the presentation of ‘Himikama’ freehold title deeds to the general public will be held in Anuradhapura today (27).

title: Netflix drops bid for Warner Bros, clearing way for Paramount takeover
byline: Netflix has backed away from its proposal to buy Warner Bros Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount Skydance to win a months-long battle for one of Hollywood’s most storied studios.

title: ‘Podi Lassie’ arrested without Interpol Red Notice, police reveal more details
byline: A total of 14 suspects have been brought back to Sri Lanka without Interpol Red Notices, Police Media Spokesperson Assistant Superintendent of Police F. U. Wootler revealed.

title: Pakistan PM says can ‘crush’ aggressors after Afghan strikes
byline: Pakistan’s Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said on Friday his country’s armed forces can “crush” aggressors, following air strikes on neighbouring Afghanistan.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes increased investments and tourists from India - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that as Sri Lanka moves towards sustainable growth, the country welcomes investors and tourists who contribute to strengthening economic and cultural ties.

title: WhatsApp Web Down: Users face login issues on Meta-owned desktop platform
byline: Several WhatsApp Web users have reported difficulties logging into their accounts, with the issue appearing to affect primarily iPhone users.

title: Ex-minister Priyankara Jayaratne’s corruption case fixed for further evidence hearing
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered the further hearing of evidence in the corruption case filed by the Bribery Commission against former Aviation Minister Priyankara Jayaratne to be called on March 24.

title: Sri Lanka officially launches Digital Nomad Visa facility; first recipients welcomed
byline: The official launch of the Digital Nomad Visa (DNV) facility in Sri Lanka was held at the “Silk Route” passenger terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake.

title: Ministry calls for report to probe environmental impact of Kerawalapitiya garbage dump fire
byline: The Ministry of Environment has taken steps to call for a comprehensive report to investigate the fire that broke out at the Kerawalapitiya garbage dumping yard and its subsequent environmental impact.

title: Appeals Court upholds death sentence on drug trafficker ‘Sudakaran’
byline: The Court of Appeal has decided to uphold the death sentence imposed on the defendant, Jayasingam Rajeev, alias “Sudakaran,” dismissing an appeal he had filed against the sentence handed down by the Colombo High Court for the possession and trafficking of 2.53 grams of heroin.

title: Poland plans social-media ban for children under 15 – reports
byline: Poland plans to introduce new legislation to ban social media for children under 15 years of age and will hold platforms responsible for age verification, Education Minister Barbara Nowacka told Bloomberg News in an interview published on Friday.

title: ‘Podi Lassie’ taken to Galle Crimes Division for further investigations
byline: Janith Madhusankha, alias “Podi Lassie” — a high-profile alleged drug trafficker wanted by police in connection with multiple homicides — who was arrested in India and brought back to Sri Lanka early this morning (27), has been handed over to the Galle District Crimes Division for further investigation.

title: Special scholarship programme for uni. students affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Board of Trustees of the Lalith Athulathmudali Mahapola Higher Education Scholarship Trust Fund has decided to introduce a special scholarship programme to be awarded on a one-time basis.

title: Colombo’s inflation drops to 1.6% in February 2026
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on a year-on-year (Y-o-Y) basis, decreased to 1.6% in February 2026, compared to 2.3% in January 2026.

title: Disaster Relief Officers halt duties from today over unmet demands
byline: Grama Niladharis, Disaster Relief Service Officers and Technical Officers have decided to temporarily halt their Cyclone Ditwah-related relief services from today (27), citing several unresolved issues.

title: Sri Lanka marks three months since devastating Cyclone ‘Ditwah’
byline: Today (27) marks three months since Cyclone Ditwah, considered one of the most devastating cyclonic storms to impact Sri Lanka, caused widespread destruction across the island.

title: Comedy legend Jim Carrey receives lifetime honour at France’s 2026 Cesar Awards
byline: France’s leading movie awards on Thursday gave Canadian-American actor Jim Carrey a special honour in recognition of his eclectic acting career, a tribute he accepted with a speech delivered in French.

title: Over 130 Afghan Taliban fighters killed in response to border attacks: Pakistan
byline: Pakistan launched a retaliatory operation in response to the alleged border attacks by the Afghan Taliban, saying it has killed over 130 Taliban fighters.

title: Blackpink’s ‘Deadline’ comeback breaks YouTube records
byline: Group Blackpink will make a comeback on the 27th at 2 p.m. with their third mini album “Deadline.” Global music fans’ attention is focused on their first full-group album in 3 years and 5 months, which will conclude their large-scale world tour that began last year.

title: Court issues 7-day detention order on ‘Podi Lassie’
byline: The Baddegama Magistrate’s Court has granted permission for the Galle Police Crime Division to detain and question for seven days the underworld figure Janith Madushanka, alias ‘Podi Lassie,’ who was brought back to Sri Lanka this morning (27) following his arrest in India.

title: Underworld figure ‘Commando Salinda’ remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered that the high-profile organised crime suspect known as “Commando Salinda,” who was previously held in the custody of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), be remanded until March 12.

title: Sri Lanka Police launches ‘Tell IGP’ online platform for public complaints
byline: Sri Lanka Police has introduced the “Tell IGP” project, an online platform that enables members of the public to submit complaints directly to the Inspector General of Police (IGP) regarding any incident or matter.

title: President attends almsgiving ceremony in memory of cyclone victims in Nelummala Village
byline: A three-month memorial almsgiving ceremony was held today (27) at Pamunupura, Batamulla, in remembrance of those who lost their lives due to the landslide that affected over five kilometres in Nelummala village, Minipe Divisional Secretariat Division in the Kandy District.

title: Pokémon turns 30: Fans still chasing the dream of ‘catch ‘em all’
byline: The global entertainment franchise Pokémon, created by Satoshi Tajiri, marked 30 years since its debut with Pokémon Red and Pokémon Green released for the Nintendo Game Boy in 1996.

title: India hands over 214-tonne Bailey Bridges consignment to Sri Lanka
byline: The First Secretary (Economic & Commercial) at the High Commission of India in Colombo today handed over a 214-tonne consignment of Bailey Bridge components to the Chairman of the Road Development Authority (RDA) and officials of the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: Mervyn Silva and Prasanna Ranaweera served indictments
byline: The Gampaha High Court has formally served indictments on a group of defendants, including former Minister Mervyn Silva and former state minister Prasanna Ranaweera, in connection with an alleged land fraud case.

title: 90-day detention order obtained for second gunman arrested over Akuregoda double murder
byline: A 90-day detention order has been obtained by police to further interrogate the second gunman arrested in connection with the double murder in Akuregoda, Thalangama.

title: Afghan Taliban open to talks after Pakistan bombs Kabul, Kandahar
byline: Afghanistan’s Taliban rulers said on Friday they were willing to negotiate after Pakistan bombed its forces in major cities and dozens of troops were killed in the most serious clashes between the allies-turned-foes.

title: Govt must reveal mastermind behind substandard coal fraud – Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa says the government must reveal the truth to the country regarding the alleged mastermind behind the substandard coal fraud.

title: 90-day detention order to question ex-intelligence chief Suresh Sallay
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has obtained a 90-day detention order to question former state intelligence chief Major General (Retd) Suresh Sallay, the police said.

title: Indian actor-politician Vijay’s wife files for divorce, alleges infidelity
byline: Sankgeetha Vijay, wife of actor-politician and TVK founder Joseph Vijay Chandrasekar has petitioned a court near here seeking divorce.
